title: Next Time Vacations: Set cruise photo as homepage hero image

requirements.summary: Add the resized cruise photo as a deployed static asset at the exact generated hero image path.
acceptanceCriteria: A file exists in the built/deployed frontend at frontend/public/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg.
The image is 1600x900 and loads successfully at /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg in the browser (no 404).

file_operations.description: Add the cropped/resized hero image asset (1600x900) to the deployed static assets at this exact path (derived from uploaded cruise-290913_1280.jpg).

requirements.summary: Ensure the homepage hero section uses the new hero image as a full-screen cover background with fade-in and gradient overlay readability.
acceptanceCriteria: On the homepage, the hero background renders the cruise photo and covers the hero area without distortion (object-fit: cover behavior).
The hero image continues to fade in when it loads, and the existing gradient overlay keeps the headline readable on top of the photo.

file_operations.description: Confirm the hero image source is exactly /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg and that the hero uses full-viewport sizing with object-fit cover behavior, preserves the existing fade-in transition, and keeps the gradient overlay for text readability.

requirements.summary: Preserve resilient hero fallback: gradient remains visible and an error message appears if the hero image fails to load.
acceptanceCriteria: If the hero image URL is invalid or the file is missing, the page still renders the hero with the gradient background and a readable error message.
No layout shifting or blank/white hero section occurs when the image fails to load.

file_operations.description: Ensure image load error handling keeps the gradient fallback visible at all times and shows a small, readable, non-layout-breaking (absolutely positioned) error message when the hero image fails to load.

requirements.summary: Ensure the HTML preload link (if present) matches the hero image path exactly so the browser preloads the correct asset.
acceptanceCriteria: After deployment, network waterfall shows the correct hero image preloading (or at minimum no preload 404).

file_operations.description: Verify (and update if needed) the existing preload link href to exactly /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg so the browser preloads the correct hero asset.
